Depth-averaged water content \(\bar{\theta}(0\!-\!z^*)\) for a stepwise profile

Source: R/utils.R
compute_weighted_avg_theta_by_depth.Rd

Computes the arithmetic, thickness-weighted average of a piecewise-constant \(\theta(z)\) profile from the absolute top \(\delta\) to a depth limit \(z^*\) (clamped to L if provided). Segments are interpreted with respect to absolute depths; uncovered portions default to \(\theta_r\).

Usage

compute_weighted_avg_theta_by_depth(
  profile,
  depth_limit,
  theta_r,
  delta = 0,
  L = NULL,
  tol = 1e-12
)

Arguments

profile

list of fronts list(list(theta=..., x=...), ...).

depth_limit

numeric; target depth \(z^*\) m for averaging.

theta_r

numeric; residual water content (used for uncovered spans).

delta

numeric; absolute depth origin m (default 0).

L

optional numeric; lower bound of the domain m; used to cap \(z^*\).

tol

numeric; small tolerance for geometric comparisons.

Value

numeric scalar \(\bar{\theta}(0\!-\!z^*)\); NA if \(z^* \le \delta\).

Examples

prof <- list(list(theta = 0.18, x = 0.2), list(theta = 0.25, x = 0.6))
compute_weighted_avg_theta_by_depth(prof,
  depth_limit = 0.5,
  theta_r = 0.05, delta = 0, L = 1.0
)
#> [1] 0.222
